57C07459405A4A68A38891B768F15CE9.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in health care (e.g., Passport to Safety certificate, reports, assignments, Ontario Skills Passport Work Plan), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

9E75948EB82143B6B77FE1C4DCCCB41E.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the health care industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, reliability);

3B183D3B76FC423D9062EEBB916ECEF0.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the health care industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., document use, decision making, finding information);

10BB2CAE5214444DA1BAA5DD73D10842.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the health care industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

AAE4BA1AE3A6473D9C59289E44F07F37.description: identify career opportunities in health care and describe the education and/or training required for entry into these occupations;

DA88CF94087F43BEB2E24AB229FDE005.description: Career Opportunities: describe career opportunities in the health care field and related educational requirements.

55175F2CD69C42E29E844D39BB41F8A7.description: describe the professional and ethical standards that health care workers are expected to adhere to (e.g., accountability, knowledge, competence, respect for patients' rights and privacy, respect for cultural and religious diversity, respect for the sanctity of life).

B3221D46BB06463FA8D46CBB31577564.description: identify and explain the principal components of legislation pertaining to health care in Ontario (e.g., Regulated Health Professions Act [RHPA] sets the framework for regulating the scope of practice of health professions);

50158B2B350247B99D29EA389C52C628.description: Professional Standards: demonstrate an understanding of legal and ethical standards governing the practice of health care

AFFDE31D19EC43B580AECF9960CD21C2.description: use protective clothing and equipment as required to keep themselves and others safe and free from harm.

ADA0B33132DB427C838389AB72C1D38F.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply safe procedures for the use of tools and equipment as outlined in safety manuals, operating instructions, and institutional requirements;

3884C9B2D0F74DA984E90E59D066959B.description: identify and comply with legislation, regulations, standards, and requirements pertaining to worker safety in the health care workplace (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Act [OHSA], Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS]);

D215FDD503C7494C96195707AB4DDBE2.description: Health and Safety: demonstrate an understanding of and comply with safe working practices and the laws and regulations governing the health and safety of workers in the health care industry;

ADDE6A98193E4C319CF0E4B3AAC5A06A.description: explain the relationship between socioeconomic status and health (e.g., differences in various health parameters among children aged 4 to 6 from different socio-economic backgrounds).

D63C7670C9644231BF567D3BD9FF0C1A.description: identify demographic and lifestyle patterns and trends (e.g., an aging population, lack of exercise) and describe their implications for the health care industry (e.g., increased obesity and susceptibility to diabetes and cardiovascular disease, changes in care needs, changes in treatments and interventions, trends in mental illness and public attitudes towards it);

DBACD3E36B544BF1AA61F010AD92CF44.description: Health Care and Society: describe the impact of current social patterns and trends on personal health and the delivery of health care.

C0B04E8EB05F4633A001F27F0C7C3406.description: describe good environmental practices that can be applied in the health care industry (e.g., using energy-efficient lighting; reducing, reusing, or recycling packaging material; storing information electronically instead of on paper).

83AC38AF03054B219D322756514A0006.description: identify safe methods for the handling, storage, and disposal of wastes and biohazardous materials (e.g., use of checklists, sharps containers, double wrapping, proper labelling);

67A5466326584CD78781D7A5EEB39991.description: describe the potential impact on the environment of biohazardous wastes from health care facilities (e.g., body fluid and human tissue, sharps containing bacteria or viruses);

B780CDFEB5AF418C8C7865239DA47F80.description: Health Care and the Environment: describe the impact of health care industry activities on the environment and identify ways of minimizing their harmful consequences;

804826F0B32F40D2820D3B967072814B.description: Health Care, The Environment, and Society

969524ED7A73438088448609C77C2AC6.description: demonstrate competence in the use of methods for collecting client data (e.g., interviews, questionnaires) and documenting client information.

799FC9023E164356BBA391D872DB9D3D.description: identify various communication barriers (e.g., barriers relating to health conditions, age, stage of development, and differing cultural communication styles), and apply strategies for overcoming them;

F6A737893A0F478594E724C1AE0A192A.description: demonstrate the ability to use basic therapeutic communication techniques (e.g., active listening and paraphrasing);

B5D0496730C64B54BAE77250419E8C06.description: Communication and Documentation: demonstrate the ability to apply a variety of techniques for communicating with clients and collecting client information.

7854E6566B3C49E385F4A934E637844C.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply safe practices for handling, preparing, and storing food in a real or simulated care environment (e.g., use proper cooking temperatures to kill bacteria; check that clients' food tolerances, requirements, or restrictions are observed).

65334EC61FC140FAB3CD0BEF197E6F5E.description: demonstrate an understanding of (e.g., through role play) and apply health and safety procedures relating to proper body mechanics and ergonomics (e.g., base of support, good body posture)

7EC97E167AD44E4FA5BE3B61034391A1.description: perform a range of motion and positioning techniques safely and correctly to prevent the development of decubitus ulcers and contractures in clients;

2AA4E9EC49724167B44B35BA23AE50E6.description: perform mobility techniques (e.g., turning, lifting, and transferring clients; using crutches or walkers and instructing clients in their use) safely and correctly;

452EDF3723BE4144B333E43E040CC369.description: perform common caregiving skills and techniques (e.g., bed making, bed bathing, feeding, toileting, oral care, weighing) safely and correctly, using baby and/or adult mannequins;

7FCB7B1983544D76A5B10DD64F6B8817.description: demonstrate an understanding of correct hand hygiene procedures (e.g., knowing when they are required, knowing when to use hand washing rather than antibacterial sanitizers), and apply as required;

CF0361381F474159AC7435348BF457C2.description: Skills and Techniques: demonstrate the ability to apply health care skills and techniques safely and to industry standards;

58892A55C3EE46C7B182273767E054B8.description: identify normal values for temperature, pulse, respiration, and blood pressure across the lifespan, and assess possible health implications of abnormal values (e.g., elevated temperature suggests a possible infection; an elevated blood pressure reading may be an early indication of hypertension).

28C82091BADE430B99B17304B6E33689.description: assess and document a client's vital signs: temperature (by oral, axillary, and tympanic routes); pulse rate (rhythm and volume by apical and radial sites); respiration rate (rhythm and character); and blood pressure;

B914E24CD3CB49438ABD0611BCFA9AA2.description: demonstrate the ability to use equipment to measure vital signs (temperature, pulse, respiration, and blood pressure);

BC46C2414757494181277FBFA385A198.description: Vital Signs: demonstrate the ability to use vital signs to determine a client's health status;

AC0BA50F1C994B8D95EBD47D30874532.description: prepare, clean, and store instruments and equipment correctly, following standard industry procedures (e.g., calibrate sphygmomanometer correctly prior to use, prepare instruments for autoclaving, clean pill cutter before and after use).

E7ECD827B33941A19079D480D6F0C0B7.description: disinfect instruments, equipment, materials, and surfaces, using accepted medical aseptic procedures, to prevent the spread of infection;

54B23D139D8842E58EA50AA14B17554A.description: identify common medical instruments (e.g., sphygmomanometer, forceps, double-ended explorer), equipment (e.g., Hoyer lift, intravenous [IV] pole, weigh scales, microscope, mouth mirror), and materials (e.g., wound dressings, bed linens and lift sheets, gloves, protective gowns, eye shields), and use them safely and correctly;

1568E0C9044C467FBF9A580CF1FE9E4E.description: Instruments, Equipment, and Materials: use health care instruments, equipment, and materials safely and correctly;

866B0E36FD0C43E7816E2BD56501DBB7.description: demonstrate an understanding of the chain of infection and the principles of infection control.

A4FA322FBA8B426EA42B55B2B605B22A.description: research and describe complementary methods of preventing and treating disease (e.g., meditation, herbal remedies, massage therapy, acupuncture, First Nations ritual of smudging to purify and cleanse the body, energy healing);

E8D00B6D159A43D89C5C88E3A988E2A3.description: research and describe conventional methods of preventing and treating disease (e.g., prescribed and over-the-counter medication, radiation treatment, chemotherapy, surgery, microscopic surgery, diet, lithotripsy);

8CE1F933A3164A199629407033021E12.description: Disease Prevention and Treatment: compare conventional and complementary methods of disease prevention and treatment.

E5A3C946E58E49D49623FE6A3F3562D5.description: identify different types of community health and social services that help people maintain active and healthy lives (e.g., community care access centres, nursing, mental health services, physiotherapy, lab services, Meals on Wheels, vision services, dental services, pharmacy services).

9A98A7D93E6843B484DA00D97F3F789F.description: assess a simulated client's dietary strengths and weaknesses and make appropriate food and nutrition suggestions, using appropriate resources (e.g., Eating Well with Canada's Food Guide [2007]; Eating Well with Canada's Food Guide: First Nations, Inuit and MÃ©tis; cultural adaptations of Canada's Food Guide available from the Ontario Public Health Association);

D1213893D0264378923A122003004194.description: identify lifestyle choices that can improve a person's health and well-being (e.g., avoidance of substance use/abuse, stress management, regular exercise, prevention of dental cavities, safe use of MP3 players and cell phones, using an Aboriginal medicine wheel as a health framework);

A23538424C5C4662ACAC093F32D5BF55.description: Lifestyle Choices : describe the relationship between lifestyle choices and personal health and well-being;

6239335CDAC64024B8A8EAFEC5747C5F.description: explain how imbalances in body systems affect personal health (e.g., an imbalance in blood glucose can lead to hypoglycemia/hyperglycemia).

91C2B487511B4F5485628FAF2D346CD6.description: identify factors that can create a homeostatic imbalance (e.g., vomiting/diarrhea can lead to dehydration and electrolyte imbalance);

E09F264E6A0B4C6DA7C8B58956D00A9C.description: identify the various balances that the body regulates in order to maintain a stable internal environment (e.g., temperature, blood glucose, acid/base, sleep, blood pressure);

0A0D4F5904C84429ADBD1CEC54B9AE8D.description: Homeostasis: demonstrate a basic understanding of homeostasis and its relationship to personal health;

F6D8CAE21D6E422B92B9566C60A09BA1.description: demonstrate an understanding of visual indicators of health status that should be noted when carrying out a health assessment of an individual (e.g., skin appearance [normal, bruised, jaundiced], breathing, posture, height, weight, alertness, balance, gait, signs of malnourishment).

3120ABA1AD1D4DE9ADDC58A288CF4DCD.description: identify the basic components of the digestive system (e.g., mouth, pharynx, esophagus, stomach, small and large intestines, gall bladder, liver), and demonstrate an understanding of how they function (e.g., by building a model to illustrate the digestive pathway);

D72D0D620EA0493785B479735662B371.description: identify the three main areas of the neurological system (i.e., cerebrum, cerebellum, brain stem) and describe their function;

140C24D9EA084E738A87B8D99A9D670C.description: identify the components of the respiratory system (e.g., larynx, epiglottis, trachea, lungs, and lung components), and demonstrate an understanding of how they function (e.g., by building a functional model to illustrate the mechanism of breathing);

E078C417E91448EF85F8558F2896B8F5.description: identify the components of the cardiovascular system (e.g., heart and heart components, veins, arteries), and demonstrate an understanding of how they function (e.g., by building a model of the heart to show major anatomical features and blood flow);

E85C929B970D485DAC8B1204F4ED3746.description: identify the components of the musculoskeletal system (e.g., major bones and muscles) and describe how they function (e.g., describe how different kinds of joints move);

FAC721743EEF441CB9086B517F212A50.description: describe the different types of tissue and the different types of cells and cell arrangements that characterize them (e.g., epithelial tissues make up the skin and inner body surfaces and are composed of tightly packed cells);

F15648C938C1413F90725AD62187AE8B.description: Anatomy and Physiology: demonstrate a basic understanding of human anatomy and physiology;

674ACCEA3B134CCC8A7E3B9504FCA2C4.description: pronounce and spell key health care terms correctly (e.g., proximal = prox-ih-mahl).

C8F3EB8182F84F4F9972C88714D1923A.description: name and identify the purpose of commonly used health care equipment (e.g., X-ray machine, phlebotomy equipment, refraction equipment, walker frames, autoclave)

E78ADC4B891541A5BB063AC95FEB480A.description: demonstrate an understanding of anatomical terminology (e.g., positional [mandibular], directional [anterior/posterior], motion [abduction]), and use it correctly in oral and written communication;

A8FA2B5F48DD4BB687EC1595DC2A4722.description: demonstrate an understanding of fundamental health care terminology (e.g., hypertension, jaundice, diabetes, obstruction, acute, chronic), and use it correctly in oral and written communication;

5AFCFCFA371B4C74A27F6A7174E4C9B1.description: Health Care Terminology: demonstrate an understanding of health care terminology and its correct usage;
